result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Murray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).
  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).
  • 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharges. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentences now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is subject to Chapter 980 review.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the dat bank, pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised:   as a convicted felon  he may not carry or possess any firearms; and that his voting privilegs are suspended during the length of this sentence.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one and concurrent with sentences now serving.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Murray in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Anthony Murray in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was scheduled for 8:15am.  Due to jury trial still in progress case was passed to 1pm.  Defendant is currently serving a prison sentence.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Patrice H.
AS to count 1:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 18 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 76 days time served and concurrent  with sentences now serving.  CONFINEMENT of 12 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS.
AS to count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 18 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 1 and concurrent with sentences now serving.  CONFINEMENT of 12 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS.
AS to count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 35 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 2 and concurrent with sentences now serving.  CONFINEMENT of 25 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges, assessments be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges DNA surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Defendant is subject to Chapter 980 review.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Written Explanaton of Determinate Sentence

Sentencing is adjourned to 9-11-2014.
Presentence report from Department of Corrections received and filed.  Defense Attorney and Assistant District Attorney notified.

Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Shaleah H. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26198822 in court 2x on 6/9/14, 6/10/14.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Leatrice H. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26198821 in court 2x on 6/9/14, 6/10/14.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Sherita H. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26198818 in court 2x on 6/9/14, 6/10/14.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 6/26/14 for Leatrice H, Shaleah H., Shalayah H. for 2 appearances each on 6/9/14, 6/10/14.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
2 envelopes - Box 627
Order for Pre-Sentence Investigation Report (PSI), Filed
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 6/10/14 for Sherita H. for 2 appearances on 6/9/14, 6/10/14.

Defendant Anthony Murray in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Anthony Murray in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury in the box at 9:10am.  Sworn for the State:  Latrice H.; Sherita H.  Jury out of the box at 10:05am.
In chambers discussion held.  Jury in the box at 10:20am.  Testimony of Sherita H. resumes.  Sworn for the State:  Chriss Hildebrand, Sexual Assault Treatment Nurse; jury out of the box at 10:50am, State's DNA expert (last witness) is currently testifying in another court (Branch 22).  Jury in the box at 11:00am.  Court advises that testimony will not be able to proceed this morning and releases the panel until 1:00pm.  Court admonishes jury not to conduct any independent investigation.  Sidebars placed on the record.
Case recalled at 1:06pm.  All parties present in court.  Court reporter Donna Richmond.
Defense counsel makes offer of proof as to testimony related to Sherita H.  Jury in the box at 1:12pm.
Recalled by the State:  Sherita H.  Sworn for the State:  Janice Maly-DNA Analyst State Crime Lab, Dept. of Justice.  Defense counsel stipulates to credentials and chain of custody.
Recalled by the State and previously sworn: S.H.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of the box at 1:55pm.  Sidebars placed on the record.
Defense moves for directed verdict which is denied by the court.  Written Waiver of Right to Testify signed by defendant and accepted by the Court.
Defense will have one witness; State will not have any rebuttal.  Jury instructions placed on the record and stipulated to by counsels and the defendant.  Jury in the box at 2:20pm.  Sworn for the Defense:  PO Karla Lehmann (MPD).  Defense rests.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Exhibits received into evidence: 1, 5, 6, 8-13, 15, 24-29, 30, 41-42.
Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Rebuttal argument by the State.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot(#21) and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:20pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Sanfelippo and Spottek who were duly sworn for that purpose.   Counsels review and stipulate to exhibits which may be sent to the jury upon request.  At the hour of 4pm jury question is addressed by Court with counsels and defendant present.  Exhibits 1A and 15A stipulated to by counsels.  At the hour of 4:30pm the jury indicated they had reached verdicts.
At the hour of 4:40 the jury returned and, by their foreperson (# 7), brought in verdicts of GUILTY as to all three counts which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdicts.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction.
Court advised defendant as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess a firearm.  Voting privileges are suspended until restored.
Court orders PSI and remands the defendant pending sentencing.  Case is adjourned to 8-4-2014 at 8:15am.  Defendant is currently at MSDF.  
Exhibit list filed.

Professional Experience:  Karla Lehmann
Statement of Qualifications: Janice Maly

Defendant Anthony Murray in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Anthony Murray in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter will proceed to jury trial.  The defendant has rejected all state offers to resolve case.
Court will order witnesses sequestered.
All motions in limine have been resolved and stipulated to. 
The State moves to orally amend count 2 of the Information to reflect date to read "between April 2, 2013 and December 25, 2013...."
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:33am.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed.  Sidebar as to strikes for cause placed on the record.  Court will allow note-taking.  Panel in the box and sworn at 11:45am.  Court instructed jury.  Court admonishes jury not to conduct any independent investigations pertaining to this case.  Court recessed for lunch.  Jury out of the box at Noon.
Court directs parties to return at 1pm.
Case recalled.  All parties present in court. Court reporter Donna Richmond.
Defendant is waiving Dobbert hearing as to testimony of PO Karla Lehmann.
Jury in the box at 1:20pm.  Opening statements by counsels.  
Sworn for the State:  PO Karla Lehmann (MPD), qualifed and accepted as an expert.  DVD of victim's interview(exhibit #9) played for jury.  Jury out of the box at 2:40pm.  Jury in the box at 2:55pm.  Conclusion of DVD played for jury.  
Sworn for the State:  S.H.(dob 9-02-2002).  Recalled for the State:  PO Lehmann. Jury out of the box at 4:25pm.  Court admonishes the jury not to conduct any independent investigations.  Parties are directed to return at 8:45am.  Sidebars placed on the record.

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Anthony Murray not in court, in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not produced timely from MSDF.  Counsels are in agreement as to portions of video to be played at trial.
Case remains in trial posture for 6-9-2014.

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Anthony Murray not in court, in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not been produced from MSDF yet.  Parties are not in agreement as to introduction of video testimony; state will review portions again today.  Case is adjourned to 6-3-2014 at 8:15.  Defendant to be produced.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SH; SHERITA H. AND HER CHILDREN; LEATRICE H.; OR ANYONE UNDER SIXTEEN YEARS OLD.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Murray in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Anthony Murray in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.
